sect1.title: Whats Covered in this Guide?
sect1.para: This document describes field recommended best practices for &susemgr;. This information has been collected from a large number of successful &susemgr; real world implementations and includes feedback generated from product management, sales and engineering.
This chapter will discuss the following topics:

formalpara.title: Users and Passwords
formalpara.para:
During both the &sle; installation and setup of &susemgr; several users and passwords will be created:
root (&sle;)
PostgreSQL user and password
Certificate of Authority password
&susemgr; Administrator's account
Safe Passwords
Please create safe passwords. Use the following guidelines when creating your passwords.
At least 8 characters long
Does not contain complete words or common terms SUSE johnsmith penguin
Contains Uppercase Characters A B C
Contains Lowercase Characters a b c
Contains Numbers 1 2 3
Contains Symbols ~ ! @ % $
Also be careful when using characters which create confusion as many fonts make it difficult to differentiate between these characters. Confusing Characters
0 and O or 1 and l

formalpara.title: Network Requirements
formalpara.para:
During &susemgr; Setup the following network requirements must be met or in place.
IP Address, Netmask, and Gateway
Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN)
DNS server resolvable both via DNS and reverse lookup
A proxy server should be setup to access the external network (when required) NTLM is currently not supported Your firewall should allow access to the following (http and https URLs)
nu.novell.com
secure-www.novell.com
update.novell.com
scc.suse.com
updates.suse.com
For communication between &susemgr; server and the &susemgr; Proxy servers for inbound and outbound traffic the following ports should be opened.
